intro: Glossocardia refracta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of leaves close to the ground. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, with a distinctive three-lobed shape. Glossocardia refracta is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
